resources.string: Accept everything just the way it is
Do not seek pleasure for its own sake
Do not under any circumstances depend on a partial feeling
Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world
Be detached from desire your whole life long
Do not regret what you have done
Never let yourself be saddened by a separation

Resentment and complaint are appropriate neither for oneself nor others Do not let yourself be guided by the feeling of lust or love In all things have no preferences Be indifferent to where you live Do not pursue the taste of good food Do not hold on to possessions you no longer need Do not act following customary beliefs Do not collect weapons or practice with weapons beyond what is useful Do not fear death8 Do not seek to possess either Goods or thiefs for your old age Respect Buddha and the gods without counting on their help God You may abandon your body but you must preserve your honor Never stray from the way Power comes in response to a need, not a desire. You have to create that need. Hard work betrays none, but dreams betray many. Forgetting is like a wound. The wound may heal, but it has already left a scar. A lesson learned with blood is never forgotten. A person grows up when he has to, when he ceases to whine and do what must be done. The pain of discipline is far less than the pain of regret. Discipline is not a form of punishment. It is the path to strength. It’s not about whether I can or can’t. I’m doing it because I want to. A person becomes strong when they have something they must protect. Rather than wish for a life without suffering look for the strength to Suffer Well and overcome it in the end Reject Pleasure which only brings short-term gratification suffer today and live tomorrow as a king among men Take your time to consider an important decision weigh its merit with unclouded judgment and you will make the right choice when the times comes If you only focus on yourself you will miss the Wonder and knowledge that the world has to offer Rather than chase things that you dont need take a moment to step back and enjoy something as simple as a cup of tea or the beauty of a flower in bloom Who you are today is not who you were yesterday nor who you will be tomorrow move on and work to become better than you were before Rather than covet what others have be grateful for the blessings you have already been Loss is a part of life redirect the pain into hard work and continue fulfilling your destiny Do not spend your whole life blaming others for your failures take responsibility for your actions and continue working towards success When Love is right you wont have to chase it it will come to you number Be unbiased open to learn from everyone and everything absorb what is useful reject what is useless add what is essentially your own - Bruce Lee It is not where you live that matters but how you live if you put too much value on your home and the possessions within it then the things you own end up owning you - Tyler Durden(Fight Club) The overindulgence of good food is beneficial for neither your mind nor your body this moderation in all things but especially in how you eat gift your unneeded possessions to those who need it more than you do material Goods cannot buy happiness those who follow the status quo will never change the world your time is limited so dont waste it living someone elses life dont be trapped by Dogma which is living with the results of other peoples thinking dont let the noise of others opinions drown out your inner voice - Steve Jobs practice what works and discard what doesnt your time is precious spend it wisely everybody dies eventually do not let the fear of death stop you from taking risks and achieving greatness foreign death Smiles at us all we can do is smile back - Marcus Aurelius your possessions are of the earth and serve no purpose when youre gone all thats left is the impact you leave behind has already given you all the tools that you need to Prevail it is up to you and you alone to use them never sacrifice who you are and what you believe in Stand Fast in your beliefs no matter the cost be unshakable in your Devotion to the set of principles under which you live your life be disciplined and even the strongest storm will fail to break you Discipline and urgency fuel real progress, not just wishful thinking. Effort and discipline will always yield results, but dreams without action will lead to regret. Every hardship leaves its mark, but it also makes you stronger. Learn from your past, don’t let it define you. Pain and failure are powerful teachers. Embrace them and become better. Maturity comes from responsibility and action, not just time. Suffering today through discipline is better than suffering tomorrow through failure. True strength comes from mastering yourself, not just your body. Discipline isn’t just about ability; it’s about willpower and persistence. True strength is born from responsibility and the will to protect what matters.
